6_1ED3Ho3kmzaKiECtyuqSjDpoE47rKuXeP.body:
> [oracle](#comment_17_1ED3Ho3kmzaKiECtyuqSjDpoE47rKuXeP): When I run update.py I get nothing, it doesn't have Done that shows up. I just tried update.py in the terminal and I got this - update.py: command not found Any idea what's wrong.

You need to click on `VERSION` and then the button to update shows up.

If you are on windows open a command prompt and go to ZeroNet folder, there you run `..\Python\python.exe update.py`
If you are on linux, you have to type `python update.py`
Open a console then type `cd "path"` **replace "path" with the directory where ZeroNet is installed** and then you run `python update.py`

I would like to make this network grow, so helping users having problems is also something important for that ;)
Also, I'm thenain38@zeroid.bit and TheNain38 on Github I'm just on another computer than my.

8_1PNyuY1iZqXBpft4ArouqcnE4pNRGYij5i.body:
> [quisp65](#comment_1_14TtpVYFjea6CwGgBTBJfpsSKNBePxGavv): I ran across it regarding news about Maelstrom (RIP I guess :-)).   People would always bring up Zeronet.  I don't mind close source alternatives.   The more people working on p2p web delivery the better.

Me too it was from looking from a decentralized internet and I've seen Maelstrom, but the fact it was closed source repulsed me and I looked at the comment section and one guy said there were ZeroNet, and the fact it was open source :)

3_12HTPzQjWn9V57oxH7fA5KV3PQZ5vuj2Fm.body: Could you add a way to close the "Welcome to ZeroMap" window?
I'm using firefox. This is because google chrome isn't open source

> [transmission](#comment_4_12HTPzQjWn9V57oxH7fA5KV3PQZ5vuj2Fm): This works fine for me on Chrome, what browser are you using?

`<dialog></dialog>` isn't supported on Firefox, IE and Edge http://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_dialog.asp

There is a polyfill here https://github.com/GoogleChrome/dialog-polyfill

1_12trw1cEg68BLZfcWnidy8EHfKE9Xh3T42.body: Je cherchai un moyen d'avoir des sites décentralisés et je suis d'abord tombé sur Maëlstrom, mais en voyant que ce n'était pas open source, j'ai abandonné directement ce projet (et dans les commentaires toutes les personnes parlait du fait que ce n'était pas open source ;) ) et dans les commentaires, quelqu'un a mit un lien vers ZeroNet, et quand je suis allé dessus, directement j'ai aimé le projet :)

C'est une version modifié de Chromium (un naviguateur internet), qui utilise aussi le réseau Bittorrent, mais on ne peut pas faire de sites dynamiques (C'est à dire comme ZeroTalk, des sites dont le contenu peut être changé par des utilisateurs), et SURTOUT, ce n'est pas open-source, ce qui fait qu'ils pourraient (Bittorrent Inc.) récupérer des informations etc... parce que le code n'est pas disponible. Et puis ZeroNet est beaucoup plus avancé et est aussi mieux fait.

3_1MCsyW6W243LY69ZYm99XbV3M8Gbbrp5hF.body: @shadowtux They really don't have the same goals, think of I2P as the network layer, and ZeroNet as the application layer, these don't have the same goal either. For me, this topic shouldn't even exist, due to comparing two things, which don't have the same goals.
